alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 1:24PM EDT until July 29 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Central Grady County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 123 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Whigham, or 9 miles northwest of Cairo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cairo, Whigham, Akridge, Grady Co A/p, Peoples Still, Capel, Elpino and Harrells Still. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
